title: Collision location for hard spheres in stationary regime
abstract:
Consider two balls with radius $r>0$ whose centers are at a distance $2$,
positioned symmetrically with respect to the origin in ${\mathbb{R}}^d$.
Suppose that the initial velocities are independent standard normal vectors.
When $r\to0$, the collision probability goes to 0 as $r^{d-1}$, and the
asymptotic collision location distribution is a (defective) $t$-distribution.
This distribution is rotationally symmetric about the origin for no apparent
reason.
